page.title: 09RECREATION
page.content: Recreation in Lydbrook.There are a variety of recreational activities for adults.Local football team has a club room in the Memorial Hall but practise a mile away on Reed's, the local paper firm's playing field.The club has plans to develop an old quarry into a sports ground.At the Memorial Hall badminton,keepfit,discos and ballroom dancing take place.The river and many local ponds account for the popularity of fishing.The children are provided with few recreational facilities.The recreational ground is rarely used in its present state.The Lydbrook Silver Band has recently built a new club house,is well supported and successful in competitions.Children must go to the local towns or other villages to find a sports centre and organisations such as Brownies or Cubs.Worral Hill does have boys football teams.
